tasks.task_description: Examine all TypeScript source files to understand current documentation state
Run all tests to verify examples work correctly

description: Add comprehensive JSDoc with tested examples to all TypeScript files in deno-proc
context:
Examined all TypeScript source files. The project has:
- src/run.ts - Main entry point for running processes (minimal docs)
- src/process.ts - Process wrapper class (good docs on types, needs examples)
- src/enumerable.ts - Core Enumerable class with many methods (some have examples, needs more)
- src/transformers.ts - Data transformation functions (minimal docs)
- src/writable-iterable.ts - WritableIterable class (minimal docs)
- src/utility.ts - Helper functions (some have good docs, needs examples)
- src/cache.ts - KV caching utilities (has one example)
- src/helpers.ts - Internal helpers (no docs)
- src/concurrent.ts - Concurrent mapping functions (minimal docs)

All files need comprehensive JSDoc with working, tested examples that demonstrate why this library is better than raw Deno APIs.
Completed run.ts documentation with 4 tested examples showing basic execution, piping, mapping, and counting. All tests pass.
Completed utility.ts documentation with 7 tested examples for range, concat, read, and isString. All tests pass.
Completed transformers.ts documentation with 5 tested examples for toBytes, jsonStringify, jsonParse, gzip, and gunzip. All tests pass.
Completed concurrent.ts documentation with 3 tested examples for concurrentMap and concurrentUnorderedMap. All tests pass.
Completed enumerable.ts documentation with 13 tested examples for enumerate, filter, reduce, take, drop, first, find, every, some, flatMap, concat, and tee. All tests pass.
Completed process.ts documentation with 3 tested examples for Process class, error handling, and stderr handling. All tests pass.
Completed writable-iterable.ts documentation with 3 tested examples for WritableIterable class, error propagation, and onclose callback. All tests pass.
Completed cache.ts and helpers.ts documentation. Cache has improved examples, helpers marked as internal with brief descriptions.
All tests pass! 75 total tests (39 new documentation tests + 36 existing tests). All TypeScript files now have comprehensive JSDoc with working, tested examples.
